Reviews.Title: “Considering the location, the rate and what's offered, it's a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Pioli_Torres
Reviews.Content: The Pacific/Mission Beach area in San Diego is a popular destination among young people from around the world looking for fun 24h/7d a week, and that's basically what you'll find there. You chose to stay here because of the beach, surf, bars, restaurants, right? No? Ok, so you need to reconsider your options... But don't get me wrong: overall it's a nice place to stay a few nights and enjoy the beach/surf/skateboard atmosphere of the area.

Reviews.Title: “So gross I got 2 days of no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: KRob_SD
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego a mere mile down the street from this hotel. I was forced to stay here by my landlord because our building was being tented for termites. Thank goodness I didn't pay for this room or I would have been extremely pissed! I was on the bottom floor on the very end of the hotel (room 101) conveniently located next to the dumpster. The flies from the trash attempted to follow me into the room which let off a musky smell. The comforter had blood stains, and other large yellow circular stains all over it (not to mention the cigarette burn holes in the comforter in our NON smoking room). There is no air conditioner but they do provide a large standing fan which works well to blast air around the tiny room. Not using the disgusting comforter, and needing to use the fan because it is the middle of summer, I had no sleep because I was in a constant temperature fluctuation battle. The bed was super hard and no better than sleeping on the ground. My body hurt the next day from being so stiff. The bathroom was old and the shower dingy with some type of rust casing the bottom of our shower. The bathroom window also provided a nice view of the Burger King across the street. I could hear the person in the room next to our snoring, as well as the sounds of the bar across the street bumping the music well into the night. I am young and go to the bar across the street as a regular, but I am really glad I don't live next to that noise; it was a traumatic experience, which I hope never to relive. My landlord gave me an apology gift certificate for a restaurant because he felt so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Budget Friendly & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KellyZ_AZ
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year when we come to San Diego. You cannot beat the location, right across the street from the beach and walking distance to grocery stores, bars, restaurants and Starbucks! The rooms are nothing fancy, but it's always been clean so we have no complaints. And you can't beat the price. This is a high energy area though, so it does get loud at times.

Reviews.Title: “The reservation was not accepted !”
Reviews.Author: Vegas033
Reviews.Content: We have gone to this hotel at least 2 times a year. We live in Nevada/ We do realize that is is not a 5 star hotel, but it is close the the beach. We made reservations using a credit card, got a confirmation number, and when we called 2 days prior to going to San Diego, the office manager had no record of our reservation ! There were not any rooms. We had to research for another hotel nearby that has received good commments ! Plus this hotel is on the side of the beach so you do not have to cross the road nor hear road noise. This hotel has air conditioning. It is is the same price range. We will NEVER trust this Mission Bay Motel again. I think the hotel inspectors need to inspect this hotel for bugs, moldew, and the mess left in the alley in behind the hotel. *Also, we always get a room on the first floor. We hope to park our car in front of the door, but we have to park our car futher away from the room that we paid for and carry our bikes, tennis raquets, and more 'toy' inside the hotel room. :(

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2439
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here previously and found it acceptable. It is close to the beach so we decided we could overlook the traffic noise. Since our last stay a bar/night club opened right across the street. At 2:00 am they push everyone out and onto the street. We were awake from 1:30 am until 4:40 am. The office closes at 12 midnight. How convenient. When I complained at 8:00 am the next morning I was told that yes a club had opened within the last year and it got very noisy. I told them after the people left the club they came into the parking lot to continue partying and fighting. They did refund my next nights stay, but that meant we had to drive home for seven hours after being there for only 24 hours. Thanks for ruining my get away weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Colorado23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is honestly in the heart of Pacific Beach. You walk right across the street and your feet touch the sand! It is near hundreds of restaurants, bars and shops. This is a perfect place for a younger family looking to stay in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Mission Bay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoraH2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location because the hotel was within proximity to many local area attractions. We visited SeaWorld, San Diego Zoo, Wild Animal Kingdom, and several eateries. The main problem we encountered was the parking lot security was not adequate at this hotel. Our vehicle was broken into during the evening hours. We filed a police report, however we were unable to recover any compensation for the loss. We're fortunate the thieves didn't steal our vehicle too. :(

Reviews.Title: “Their service is terrible. Worst experience I've honestly ever had.”
Reviews.Author: ocean_frog
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the good point: Location. It's a minutes walk away from the ocean, restaurants and nightlife. Now to the bad: The water faucet had a really hard to operate, stuck lever. The sheets were dirty, and it was disgusting to sleep in them. It's near all the bars, so don't expect a very quiet night in your room with cars driving by and people yelling around from time to time. I didn't mind too much though. They advertise free wireless internet for their guests. The connection in my room was extremely weak, so I wasn't able to work on my time-sensitive projects. I complained, and they gave me a key to another room where it should be a lot better. So I packed and lugged all my luggage over, trusting them they knew what they were saying was right. There the wireless turned out to be even worse. When I got home the next day and I walked into the room in the afternoon, I was greeted with water splashing out of a completely soaked carpet with every step. Ok, admittedly there was a strong downpour which did cause a lot of flooding around the area, but apparently that happens yearly. Besides making sure that those rooms don't end up being flooded every year, they should have had their room service check the flooded rooms to make sure that no guests left sensitive items on the floor â€“ e.g. clothing, documents, laptops, ... They also should have offered a new room immediately, without me actually having to ask for one. I ended up getting so fed up that I checked out of the hotel at 11PM at night, lugging my luggage over to the (now relocated) Bed & Bay Residence Inn nearby which turned out to be an excellent choice â€“ even closer to the beach, nicer, cheaper & friendlier. I've never had to experience anything as bad as this yet â€“ this was really a first for me.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie079
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and well kept. The staff was friendly and helpful. For this price, we were one block away from the beach and in a central location. The pool was clean, and not crowded. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachy Motor Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: AlwysL8r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June and LOVED it. Let me be very frank, this is not a ritzy elegant hotel, so don't expect a concierge and Westin beds. But this is a great value and fantastic location. The motel is literally a block from the beach and about 3 blocks to Grand Ave where all the fun Pacific Beach restaurants, shops and bars are located. There is a market right next to the motel and a starbucks a block away. What I loved about the hotel was that our car could be parked right outside of our room, and we could leave it there for the trip (parking is really horrible in PB). The room was your basic motel room with no extra frills, but it did have a sizeable closet compared to its Motel 6 counterpart. There was a TV, 2 pretty comfortable double beds, a smaller bathroom with just a shower and the closet. There is no air conditioning, but there are fans. Frankly, you do not need the air conditioning at all! I was totally comfortable the entire time, and I can be pretty heat sensitive. We had no issues with noise, bugs, dirtiness or rudeness. The management warned me when I made the reservation that they don't tolerate extra people in the rooms or partying, and I totally understand that sentiment. I would recommend this hotel to the budget traveler who wants to be in a fantastic location, and doesn't mind simple rooms. I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Management prejudice.”
Reviews.Author: dereknicole
Reviews.Content: Not only do these Managers pick and choose the guests they like and dislike as they walk through the door, based on what I am not sure, they have no customer service skills what-so-ever. Plus, guests are only allowed 1 parking spot per room. And there is no convenient alternative parking. Our group had two couples and three vehicles in a two bed room. All vehicles had come from different areas 2 from different states. We were not told we could only have 1 parking spot until time of check-in, and one vehicles was handicap. We decided that we would park one car two-blocks away, one in a regular spot, and the handicapped vehicle in the handicapped spot. As we are sleeping at 11:15 at night the phone rings its the front desk telling us to move one vehicle or it will be towed. We argued with them that this situation is uncalled for. In the morning the same spot we moved our vehicle out of at 11:30 at night was still open. My Husband and I, and the other couple we were with, are not sure why they chose to pick on us. We hope no one else has to deal with these two men. They should not be in any service industry working with people.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches & Customer Service Not To Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Duchess26
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at this property was proabably one of the most horrid traveling experiences I can recall. We had the unexpected bugs in the bathroom and the innkeepers from a little place called hell. The management told me that I "did not need to come down to the office to [--]," when I tried to resolve our situation. They also refused to give us the telephone number to the owner & said all complaints must go through them first. Good luck getting any issue resolved at this facility. I was completely creeped out & will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location by the Beach”
Reviews.Author: A57moon
Reviews.Content: Well, having stayed at this location several times over the past 7 1/2 years, I am surprised that neither I nor anyone else has written about it. Well, ok...perhaps that MIGHT be, because there truly isn't much to say? The Mission Bay Motel is simply what it sounds like. A Motel. It has quite a few years on it, ( Oh, I'd venture a guess of about 30 years or more) and offers few "extras" or amenities as you might expect in most Hotels or other Motels ( ie; Days Inn, Motel 6, etc). The rates I have paid vary anywhere from $60 up to $160 depending upon the time of year and the room. Romms seem to vary from a single ( which are located on the western side of the property both up and downstairs ( 2 level establishmant) to the room with 3 beds( no, not a 3 bedroom...1 room --- 3 beds) with a kitchenette( actually a stove and a mini-fridge with some supplied utentils). You are not really paying for the simpleness of this location ( though there is a small pool directly behind the office on the Mission Blvd with a fence around it) but more so for the location......one block from THE BEACH!!. There is also a Hooter's Restaurant directly across the street and up the stairs. There is also one of the best bars for sightseeing in Southern California called La Heina's ( located ON the beach boardwalk and slightly to the south) which is touted as the ONLY open deck bar in California located on the Boardwalk. I sure would love to know if this is true, but aftre a couple hours there you forget why you are there. Back to the Motel, though, there is no ice machine, there is no soda machine, there are no vending machines. There is a liquor store on the same block just to the south. There is a Burger King JUST to the North across the street. There is a Tony Roma's restaurant across the steet, as well as a couple of fantastic breakfast eateries ( make sure to visit The Eggery for early morning breakfast). The Motel does offer both smoking and non-smoking rooms, but of course I can only tell you that I have seen smoking rooms during all but 1 of my stays. One time I did have to stay in a non-smoking room which I hated, but respected by stepping outside to smoke. I can't say how often that practice is followed, so be prepared. All the rooms have a color tv with a remote and get basic cable ( about 60 or so channels) and HBO only. They do have a little clock radio with AM/FM but you'd be better served to do as I do and bring a Boom-Box and CD's ...after all...you are at the beach!! You may wish to bring your cooler or a mini-fridge to store soda, beer, ice in. You depending on how long you are staying, you may even want to bring a mutli-outlet as they only have a couple of outlets in the rooms. Speaking of, one of the BEST things about staying at the wonderfully simple motel, is not the name, the service, the maids, but something MUCH more.The LOCATION!! Think of it this way. you are in Pacific Beach...you can go drinking on Garnet St and walk back to your room ( 4 blocks) and not worry about drinking and driving. You can also get a room as I do on most holiday weekends ( unless I am in Vegas) and go enjoy yourself with beer on the beach and make or take at least ONE good reliable friend who will watch your belongings on the beach while you walk ONE BLOCK back to your room to use your own BATHROOM. See what a worthwhile investment it is? No drinking and driving, good location, parking is ok except for on weekends . Most get parking in front of their rooms. Some may have to park on the north end of the Motel or on the street. Holiday weekends parking is insane, so if you are there on a Friday, my advice is DO NOT LEAVE. Take a taxi to downtown for about $25 bucks, a bus ( which stops in front of the motel) or walk. If you live in town, just take a cab down, why bring the car? If you have kids, be preapred as this is a beach area and sometimes the language and scenery can be a bit R-rated, but not too. Police try and keep a good job on things, but as in any college town, summer destination, where you have women , men ( well..young men) , beach and beer well....sometimes you need a little extra help. The staff at this motel is wonderful though sometimes a little tired from long hours trying to help guests and keep an eye on things. They always keep fresh coffee in the office and a number of flyers for out of town guests to use for sightseeing around the area. Simply put, this is in my opinion, a great value for your money. If you need glitz and glamour, there are other hotels/motels around the way, but if, like me, you care for a tv, a locked door and convience, this is your place. In all of my stays, I have never seen any pests of any sort...so that has never been an issue. At least for me. As many times as I have been there, I have never once had any problem other than a problem with a backed up toilet which was repaired quickly. Lots of foreigners tend to stay here I would imagine because of "Location" and "Zonies because.....It's near water. Not sure what a 'Zonie is? Ask when you check in... Have Fun

HotelInfo.Name: Mission Bay Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 4221 Mission Blvd., San Diego, CA 92109
